sen.j: 橘 道貞（たちばな の みちさだ、生年不詳 - 長和5年4月16日 (旧暦)（1016年5月24日））は、平安時代中期の官僚。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Michisada (year of birth unknown - May 24, 1016) was a bureaucrat, who lived during the mid-Heian Period.
TACHIBANA no Michisada (year of birth unknown - May 24, 1016) was a bureaucrat, who lived during the mid-Heian Period.
TACHIBANA no Michisada (year of birth unknown - May 24, 1016) was a bureaucrat, who lived during the mid-Heian Period.

sen.j: 従五位下下総国守橘仲任の子。
sen.e: He was the son of TACHIBANA no Nakato, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province).
He was the child of TACHIBANA no Nakato, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province).
sen.cmt: son ⇒ child に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the child of TACHIBANA no Nakato, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province).
He was a close adviser of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
He was a close adviser of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
He was a close adviser of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.

sen.j: そのため兄とともに「道」の字を与えられたという。
sen.e: It is said that because of his position, he and his older brother was given the character '道' (michi) by Michinaga to include in their respective names.
sen.cmt: 「道」の字→the character '道' (michi) と漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: It is said that because of his position, he and his older brother were given the character '道' (michi) by Michinaga to include it in their respective names.
sen.cmt: was ⇒ wereに訂正しました。include it に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is said that because of his position, he and his older brother were given the character '道' (michi) by Michinaga to include it in their respective names.

sen.j: 和泉国守、陸奥国守などを歴任した地方官僚でいわゆる受領階級。
sen.e: He was a local bureaucrat who successively held important positions such as Izumi no kuni no Kami (Governor of Izumi Province) and Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province), belonging to the so called 受領階級Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) class.
sen.cmt: 受領階級→定訳不明：Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) class （統一用語ではZuro rankとありましたが、Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) classとしました。）
sen.e: He was a local bureaucrat who successively held important positions such as Izumi no kuni no Kami (Governor of Izumi Province) and Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province), belonging to the so called Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) class.
sen.cmt: 受領階級 を削除しました。
sen.e: He was a local bureaucrat who successively held important positions such as Izumi no kuni no Kami (Governor of Izumi Province) and Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province), belonging to the so called Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) class.

sen.j: 藤原道長の覚えもめでたかった。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Michinaga also appreciated him.
FUJIWARA no Michinaga also appreciated him.
FUJIWARA no Michinaga also appreciated him.

sen.j: 最初の妻は、和泉式部として後世に名を残した越前国守大江雅致の娘、介内侍と呼ばれていた女性と結婚。
sen.e: His first wife was the daughter of OE no Masamune, Echizen no kuni no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), and she, whose name was Suke no Naishi, was well known as Izumi Shikibu in later time.
His first wife was the daughter of OE no Masamune, Echizen no kuni no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), and she, whose name was Suke no Naishi, was well known as Izumi Shikibu in later time.
His first wife was the daughter of OE no Masamune, Echizen no kuni no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), and she, whose name was Suke no Naishi, was well known as Izumi Shikibu in later time.

sen.j: 後に離婚し、再婚している。
sen.e: Later he was divorced from her and got remarried.
Later he divorced her and got remarried.
sen.cmt: divorced her に訂正しました。
sen.e: Later he divorced her and got remarried.

sen.j: 和泉式部の和泉は道貞の当時の官職、和泉守に由来する。
sen.e: The part of 'Izumi' in the name of Izumi Shikibu derives from the government post that Michisada was holding.
The part of 'Izumi' in the name of Izumi Shikibu derives from the government post that Michisada was holding.
The part of 'Izumi' in the name of Izumi Shikibu derives from the government post that Michisada was holding.

sen.j: 二人の間には後に小式部内侍と呼ばれる女児があった。
sen.e: The couple had a daughter called Koshikibu no Naishi.
The couple had a daughter called Koshikibu no Naishi.
The couple had a daughter called Koshikibu no Naishi.

sen.j: 朝日新聞社発行の「日本歴史人物事典」では、橘広相の孫とされるが、誤伝または誤記。
sen.e: In "Nihon Rekishi Jinbutsu Jiten" (Dictionary of Japanese History and Figures) published by The Asahi Shinbun, he was described as a grandson of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, but it was an erroneous record or a misdescription.
sen.cmt: 「日本歴史人物事典」→定訳不明："Nihon Rekishi Jinbutsu Jiten" (Dictionary of Japanese History and Figures) としました。
sen.e: In "Nihon Rekishi Jinbutsu Jiten" (Dictionary of Japanese History and Figures) published by The Asahi Shinbun, he is described as a grandson of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, but it is an erroneous record or a misdescription.
sen.cmt: was ⇒ is に訂正しました。
sen.e: In "Nihon Rekishi Jinbutsu Jiten" (Dictionary of Japanese History and Figures) published by The Asahi Shinbun, he is described as a grandson of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, but it is an erroneous record or a misdescription.

sen.j: 仲任の父は従五位下下総守橘佐臣で、佐臣の父、従四位下筑前国守橘茂枝と贈従三位中納言橘広相は又従兄弟の関係になる。
sen.e: Nakato's father was TACHIBANA no Saomi (佐臣), Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province), and Saomi (佐臣)'s father, TACHIMANA no Shigee (橘茂枝), who was ranged 従Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Chikuzen no kuni no Kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province), and TACHIMANA no Hiromi, ranked Zo-Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank, posthumously conferred) Chunagon (Middle Councilor), were second cousins.
sen.cmt: 橘佐臣→正式な読み方が不明です：TACHIBANA no Saomi (佐臣)としました。 橘茂枝→正式な読み方が不明です：TACHIMANA no Shigee (橘茂枝) としました。
sen.e: Nakato's father was TACHIBANA no Saomi (佐臣), Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province), and Saomi (佐臣)'s father, TACHIMANA no Shigee (橘茂枝), who was ranked Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Chikuzen no kuni no Kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province), and TACHIMANA no Hiromi, ranked Zo-Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank, posthumously conferred) Chunagon (Middle Councilor), were second cousins.
sen.cmt: ranged ⇒ ranked に訂正しました。従 を削除しましｓた。
sen.e: Nakato's father was TACHIBANA no Saomi (佐臣), Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shimofusa no kuni no Kami (Governor of Shimofusa Province), and Saomi (佐臣)'s father, TACHIMANA no Shigee (橘茂枝), who was ranked Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Chikuzen no kuni no Kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province), and TACHIMANA no Hiromi, ranked Zo-Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank, posthumously conferred) Chunagon (Middle Councilor), were second cousins.
Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province).
Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Mutsu no kuni no Kami (Governor of Mutsu Province)
